results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 37]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film shows some wonderful car racing in Victoria and South Australia in 1953 and 1955. Includes the Templestowe and Rob Roy hill climbs, races at Altona and Baxter Park, and the Grand Prix at Port Wakefield.

While some footage is overexposed there are good scenes of the cars and spectators. Drivers shown include Jack Brabham, Reg Hunt, Kevin Neal and Doug Whiteford. Brabham is shown winning the 1955 Australian Grand Prix.

This film was originally made using 16mm film.

00:12:03 racing around dirt track – Baxter Park, Frankston

00:18:03 cars racing at Altona
00:18:35 mechanics working on car engine

00:21:43 ‘The end’ title card

00:22:22 racing on track

00:29:26 Grand Prix, Port Wakefield, South Australia

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 23]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film shows the Australian ‘outback’, focussing on Alice Springs. The start of the reel has shots of roads, erosion alongside the roads, surrounding countryside and distant views as well as Kenneth’s car on the road - an image he often used to indicate the film will capture a roadtrip.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:00:00 starts with a title card ‘Hello Alice’.

00:31:00:00 Map of Australia honing in on Alice Springs.

00:46:00:00 sign ‘Pichi Richi Pass - Caution - Creeks and Corners’.

00:1:09:0000:01:47:00 we sight a small steam train.

00:02:10:00 a rail bridge.

00:02:38:00 travellers arrive at the township of Quorn (South Australia)

00:03:01:00 the Quorn train station; long transport steam trains. sign for the township of Marree.

00:04:15:00 footage includes looking at the wheels and tracks, passengers awaiting trains, local Indigenous people, scenes of the outback taken from the train.

00:06:10:00 the traintrip reaches the township of Beresford and then the William Creek Hotel at 00:06:40:00 where we see passengers having fetched bottles of beer from the hotel sprinting back to the train.

00:06:50:00 a glimpse of (probably) brumbies and more scenes of locals and the surrounding countryside from travelling train.

00:09:27:00 we sight traindrivers or workers walking alongside the train, travel by a sheep station and through a very arid landscape.

00:10:20:00 the sign for Alice Springs comes into view. Kenneth starts a tour of the town with some police officers speaking to the camera and footage of families and their cars in one of the streets. Footage includes wandering around the wide dusty roads, people walking and on bicycles and then a look at the buildings - houses, a focus on an older building made (unusually of brick), eucalyptus trees and a flowering garden,

00:11:33:00 we see a sign for the ‘Australian Inland Mission Hostel for bush mothers and children’ on a building that Kenneth gives us several views of including a motorbike outside. This is followed by a view of a new and very modern looking building, surrounded by vegetable or market gardens and out front of which Mrs Rankine chats with acquaintances who point her up to a monument on a hill.

00:12:10:00 is a view from the monument, overlooking the town including views of its oval and what appears to be a prison.

00:13:19:00 view of eucalypts in the surrounding landscape.

00:13:40:00 we see a marker for ‘Flynn’s Grave’ which is a beautiful boulder perched on a stone pedestal.

00:14:04:00 a sign for ‘Standley Chasm’ appears and begins a sequence of dramatic and beautiful scenes of rocky outcrops, foliage and trees. Kenneth films some walkers among the rocks which shows the size and context of the environment.

00:15:31:00 we see two Indigenous horsemen followed by a sign for ‘Hermannsberg’ and some shots of the mission church building, some members of the community and a group of children smiling for the camera. The reel ends with some last looks at the landscape.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 34]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria including views of Melbourne, South Australia and the Australian Capital Territory (A.C.T).

This film shows a road trip of over 2,000 miles (3,200 kms) through south-east Australia in a Riley motor car in the early 1950s.

Excellent scenes of country driving and towns visited including Lakes Entrance, Boydtown, Eden, Canberra, Echuca, Cohuna and Renmark before returning to Melbourne.

Opening with the title ‘The Dream Car’ a dream of a new car brings it to reality in a melodramatic piece and the travellers set off on their road trip.

Excellent views of the Riley car (appears to be a 1951 model), cars of the era in various towns and a very undeveloped Canberra and institutions such as the original National Library building and the Australian War Memorial.

This film was originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list
00:00:00 KenRa opening credit sequence
00:00:10 ‘The Dream Car’ title card
00:00:14 woman looking through Riley car brochure
00:00:40 old car driven by women pulls in to driveway
00:01:08 more modern car takes its place (the 1951 Riley)
00:02:20 interior of car and engine
00:02:58 looking in boot (trunk)
00:03:16 man affixes side mirror to front car bumper
00:03:51 ‘Months later’ title card
00:04:02 ‘We make a trip’ title card
00:04:02 ‘of 2487 miles’ title card
00:04:07 farewells in driveway
00:05:02 map shows route east through Victoria
00:05:09 car on country roads
00:05:22 Lakes Entrance on map
00:05:23 views around Lakes Entrance
00:06:33 Boydtown on map
00:06:36 car outside building
00:06:52 boy approaches tower, views of Tudor style hotel
00:08:43 views of beach
00:09:09 inspecting ruined church
00:10:11 Eden on map

00:11:15 houses around coast
00:11:21 boy with large fish
00:11:44 timber mill / timber yard
00:12:18 truck enters timber mill / timber yard
00:12:55 Canberra on map
00:12:59 view of Canberra from high vantage point
00:13:03 Canberra house styles
00:13:36 Melbourne Ave street sign
00:13:45 view of the Republic of China in Taipei Embassy
00:13:57 views of the rear of Parliament House
00:14:40 great views of cars of the era in car park
00:16:00 churches and cemetery
00:16:20 original National Library building on King’s Ave
00:16:32 church with steeple
00:17:37 front of Parliament House and King George V memorial
00:18:00 Hotel Canberra
00:18:25 Albert Hall
00:18:40 Melbourne and Sydney buildings in civic centre
00:19:25 USA Embassy
00:19:44 views from hill of Canberra
00:20:00 Australian War Memorial showing lack of landscaping, interiors and exhibits and dioramas
00:20:05 inspecting submarine (looks to be recently installed)
00:22:56 Canberra buses with conductor and front and rear exit doors
00:23:34 Beauchamp House (now Ian Potter House) in Acton
00:23:40 dog on the tuckerbox Gundagai
00:23:53 dam spillway
00:24:18 good example of steel road bridge
00:24:36 Echuca on map
00:24:38 riverboat / paddles steamer being painted and views of Murray River
00:24:51 paddle steamer and riverboats at dock
00:25:16 good views street scenes lines with palms
00:25:30 card parked in street, horse drawn cart passing
00:25:45 frill necked lizard
00:26:01 Cohuna on map
00:26:10 Cohuna Hotel and street scenes
00:27:20 inspecting a steel wheeled tractor being used to pump water
00:27:37 farmers posing for camera
00:27:56 three young girls with calf posing for camera – very sweet
00:28:13 girls, adults and calves in paddock
00:29:01 Renmark on map
00:29:04 palm tree lined garden at river’s edge
00:29:44 Hotel Renmark and street scenes
00:30:02 PS Gem paddle steamer
00:30:19 woman holding baby kangaroo (joey)
00:30:40 PS Gem sailing to Mildura leaves dock and sails away
00:31:40 passengers on board, views of river and shore, passing under vertical lift bridge
00:32:35 passing through lock gates
00:34:05 mowing lawn with petrol mower – terrific early mower
00:34:33 red phone box, Riley pulls up alongside, man makes call
00:36:05 car pulls in to Melbourne home driveway
00:36:29 travellers welcomed home

description_for_label:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria including views of Melbourne, South Australia and the Australian Capital Territory (A.C.T).

This film shows a road trip of over 2,000 miles (3,200 kms) through south-east Australia in a Riley motor car in the early 1950s.

Excellent scenes of country driving and towns visited including Lakes Entrance, Boydtown, Eden, Canberra, Echuca, Cohuna and Renmark before returning to Melbourne.

Opening with the title ‘The Dream Car’ a dream of a new car brings it to reality in a melodramatic piece and the travellers set off on their road trip.

Excellent views of the Riley car (appears to be a 1951 model), cars of the era in various towns and a very undeveloped Canberra and institutions such as the original National Library building and the Australian War Memorial.

This film was originally made using 16mm film.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 14]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

In this film titled ‘By Road to Adelaide’, the Rankine family travel to Adelaide. The footage that Kenneth takes along the way is a wonderful insight into holiday life on the road in the forties. Mrs Rankine and Bettye Rankine actively take part in the film by posing with the car along the road, in the gardens, at an Adelaide cafe and at flooded roads on the return trip. This reel uses the credit ‘An A.C. Rankine Film’ (rather than KenRa presents) and sequence title cards.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:19:00 ‘By Road to Adelaide’ and “Between Heywood and Mr Gambier”.

00:00:40:00 Mrs Rankine and Bettye Rankine pose for Kenneth’s camera in and around the family car, on a wide country road and at a milestone marked 241 (miles) and M (Melbourne).

00:01:42:00 Bettye is sitting on the running board of their car; luggage trunk strapped to the rear of the vehicle (rather than a carboot).

00:02:16:00 sign for the ‘South Australia Border’.

00:02:25:00 ‘Mt Gambier and The Lakes’, gardens, Blue Lake, flowers, treetops, a quick shot of a town.

00:05:12:00 ‘Kingston to Meningie’ shows us another lake which could be the ‘Pink Salt Lake’ at Meningie because footage shows reeds and grasses and a view of Mrs Rankine and Bettye standing on what seems like a salt plain before looking cold and seeking refuge in the car.

00:06:43:00 ‘Tailem Bend and nearing Adelaide’ where we see more salty landscape and lake and the travellers taking off from a tiny township.

00:07:28:00 ‘Adelaide the City and Gardens’ after which we look along North Terrace, and at busy city street. Mrs Rankine and Bettye are dressed more formally whilst meeting with a companion whose hair is a great example of a popular forties hairstyle inspired by Hollywood - the ‘Betty Grable updo’. This woman holds a tray of what appears to be ceramic craft work for the camera.

00:08:42:00 Bettye and her mother in a cafe, being served by a waitress in a uniform.

00:09:14:00 river views followed by the Adelaide City Bridge and the River Torrens Foobridge; these scenes are filmed from a boat on the river.

00:13:54:00 Bettye Rankine holding a koala in front of a garden water fountain.

00:14:28:00 ‘Port Elliot and Victor Harbour’ appears followed by great examples of 1940’s canvas holiday tents pitched directly on a beach.

00:15:45:00 ‘Homeward Bound Through the Floods’ introduces the last scenes which is footage of flooded roads. These scenes show the difficulty of travelling distances on country roads in this era.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 10]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film shows tugboats assisting ships into the piers at the Port of Melbourne and stars the “James Paterson” boat on which Kenneth is filming. The scenes in the reel show a lost world of shipping and the manual labour of port operations. The reel ends with the ‘James Paterson’ tugboat at the dock.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:30:00 title card ‘Pushing and Pulling’ and “starring James Paterson and Norman C. McBain”. Shortly after, we see a tugboat named ‘James Paterson’.

00:03:31:00 scenes of the workings of the tugboats in assisting ships in and out of port, stoking the engine fires, ships crews looking down from the great height of their vessels whilst the tugboats manoeuvre around them.

00:03:45:00 shots of boats and water and a large ship ‘Pipiriki’ leaving a pier and being towed by a tugboat from where Kenneth is filming, presumably on the ‘James Paterson’; we see shots of a harbour and ships and boats passing by as well as one the tugboat operator at the wheel.

00:04:07:00 we see the ship ‘Sanoma’ followed by men working lines on the tugboat alongside the ship.

00:07:55:00 ‘Melbourne Star’ ship, the ‘Wombat’ tugboat and ‘River Murumbidgee’.

00:09:15:00 we see a close up of rope work by the crew of the ‘Clan Macaulay’.

00:10:05:00 shows a great closeup shot of workers chatting on the tugboat.

00:11:50:00 a good shot of one of the dockside piers.

00:12:13:00 sequence from this point shows a ship hoisted into dry dock - Kenneth uses shots of the boat stop signal, a dry dock supply shop and the pier to emphasise the dry dock surrounds.

00:13:00:00 the scene changes to night time on the water followed by some passenger ships.

00:12:13:00 sequence from this point shows a ship hoisted into dry dock - Kenneth uses shots of the boat stop signal, a dry dock supply shop and the pier to emphasise the dry dock surrounds.

00:13:00:00 the scene changes to night time on the water followed by some passenger ships.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 11]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film is a scenic tour of mostly seaside places, from Sydney Harbour and Port Phillip Bay to a brief look at Phillip Island. The Rankine family members feature and are joined by Bob Wootton late in the reel who contributes to their roadside picnic by cooking meat on a barbecue over a fire in a tin. Kenneth uses individual title cards to clearly point out the locations he is filming and fnishes sunset scenes. Kenneth also uses title cards to introduce each sequence.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:12:00 ‘Sydney and the Harbour’, views across the Harbour to residential areas; Kenneth appears to be filming from a vantage point on the water.

00:01:07:00 Harbour Bridge followed by shots of ferries and dockside buildings; a larger ship comes into view as well as Fort Denison Island and a longer shot of the Harbour Bridge.

00:03:20:00 ‘Manly’, the pier and some buildings.

00:03:40:00 shops and shoppers with the camera taking in the view down to the Harbour; beach scenes and a large ship in the distance.

00:04:48:00 ‘Blue Mountains from Echo Point’ is followed by dramatic views over the mountain ranges and rock formations.

00:05::39:00 the Rankines meeting some other travellers along a walking track.

00:05:51:00 scenes of a sports club and members relaxing, the men are in blazers.

00:06:16:00 ‘The Cascades Leura’, waterfalls, a footbridge and Mrs and Miss Rankine splashing at the foot of a waterfall.

00:07:41:00 a band playing in a large rotunda Spanish exhibition dancing for onlookers; this sequence also shows good examples of vintage bathers.

00:08:32:00 ‘St Kilda’, the St Kilda Botanical Gardens.

00:09:17:00 scenes looking across Pier Rd to the St Kilda Pier, kiosk and a yacht followed by shots of swimmers.

00:10:07:00 ‘At Elwood’ shows more examples of vintage bathing costumes with a beach coat and caps and launching a sail boat straight from the sand.

00:11:14:00 ‘At Mid Brighton’ small craft bobbing in shallow waters followed by a yacht race and Kenneth’s daughter with binoculars looking on.

00:13:07:00 ‘At Sandringham’ shows another sequence of swimmers, people sunbathing, sailboats and diving from what might be an old piece of a jetty, sitting on rocks on the shoreline; there are bathing boxes in the background on the beach.

00:16:50:00 a small boat being hoisted down from a shed and rolled on tracks into the water.

00:18:00:00 onwards we see the Rankines joined by Bob Wootton who contributes to their roadside picnic with his meat patties/ burgers, barbecued over a fire in a tin.

00:18:32:00 ‘Phillip Island’ is introduced with a postcard before coastal views and several shots of koalas in trees, the family wandering along a road.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 7]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

In this film Kenneth and some fellow travellers visit the Grampians showing the varied scenery across the mountainous ranges and the valley, groups of people relaxing and enjoying natural surrounds as well as hiking and gathering for a picnic.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:07:00 title card ‘Our Grampians’ starts us off travelling along a country road where we see the sign to Halls Gap and other local towns, followed by a sign for “Hotel Bellfield” and a spot of golf.

00:00:02:00 ‘Splitter Falls’ sign appears ahead of more views of the mountainous range, roads and the valley below.
00:04:12:00 a very long waterfall.

00:04:57:00 a group of tourist overlooling the hills from a high vantage point.

00:05:13:00 a photographer setting up a spectacular looking shot of people sitting on rocks.

00:06:37:00 toasting bread on an open fire and the sign ‘New scenic track to McKenzie Falls’.

00:09:27:00 women holding a bunch of wildflowers one of whom sports a classic 40’s headscarf style.

00:10:21:00 we see a tree being prepared for felling by two mean using a double ended saw followed by a logging truck.

00:11:14:00 sign to ‘Wonderland’ followed by a large group of people trekking up a rocky incline, taking rests on the rocks, climbing narrow ravines and finally looking out from the top.

00:15:07:00 the travellers stand around a fire with a billy-can, cooking lambchops and bread.

00:17:12:00 a farmer and his tractor from a close view and pink tinged clouds.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 9]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film is more whimsical in approach than the family based footage seen in other films, as reflected by the title ‘Open Road Open Sky’. In the opening scene we see Kenneth a fellow traveller wandering along country roads as well as shots of roads into the distance and the skies overhead. Further into the reel we see the Sherbrooke Forest, the ‘Burnham Beeches’ and ‘Alfred Nicholson Memorial Gardens’. There are shots of several animals such as emu and echidna as well as quite a bit of birdlife and Kenneth’s favourite shots of flowers and trees. The reel ends with Kenneth walking away from the forests and an end title shot.

Selected sequence list:

00:00:27:00 title ‘Open Road Open Sky’, Kenneth and a fellow traveller wandering along country roads.

00:01:00:00 large power poles along country roads, a few examples of country houses.

00:01:47:00 kangaroos and peacocks.

00:02:45:00 Kenneth walks along a road with his camera.

00:03:14:00 an emu, echidna and a wallaby come into view.

00:04:15:00 close up of Kenneth filming behind his camera followed by ‘Burnham Beeches’ mansion and estate in Sherbrooke Forest and the ‘Alfred Nicholson Memorial Gardens’.

00:06:31:00 birdlife inlcuding storks and lyrebirds.

00:07:44:00 Indigenous rider on horseback, waving at the camera whilst he rounds up horses, camels and Shetland ponies on grassland.

00:08:07:00 brolgas (filmed only from neck down only so difficult to be certain).

00:10:03:00 a quick shot of a woman behind the camera.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 31]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film begins with the title ‘Beauty in Victoria’ which is Kenneth’s reference to the beauty that includes nature, the Queen, a ‘bathing beauty’ contest and city night lights. Titles for the reel also include ‘Visit the Buchan Caves’ with specific directions to a ‘Modern Camp Site’ both of which introduce a lengthy look at the Buchan area. The reel ends with a quick look at ‘Port Campbell’.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:28:00 on the way to the caves, the Rankines make a stop at the Caves Hotel where Mrs Rankine keeps an eye on a magpie alongside the family car which as always, features in Kenneth’s travel footage.

00:00:39:00 the camp site is within the ‘Buchan Caves National Park’ whcih is well signed on an overhead stone archway.

00:00:49:00 begins a sequence of shots that show off the ‘modern’ camp site. We see the ‘A E LIND’ Swimming Pool, the various amenities and stone and timber buildings of the camp area such as the ‘Children’s Playground’, ‘Kitchen’ and ‘Carwash’. We also see a wonderful red truck of the era and plenty of wandering sheep.

00:01:55:00 we see Mrs Rankine at the ‘Royal Cave’ entrance.

00:02:26:00 a sequence of farmland views and shots of a bluetongue lizard.

00:03:27:00 title ‘Coronation Week’ begins with a picture of the Queen followed by various buildings decorated in British colours of red, white and blue.

00:03:58:00 decorated Palais theatre and Luna Park at St Kilda.

00:04:41:00 Melbourne city streets and department stores such as a highly decorated Myer and Foy’s departments stores, and the Queen’s name across the Elizabeth St entrance to the Flinders St Station.

00:05:30:00 Kenneth begins a nightlights sequence to show the decorations in neon.

00:09:33:00 ‘The Sun Beach Girl Finals’ where Kenneth films the parade and judges without filming the winner but showing the popularity of these events.

00:14:04:00 title ‘Port Campbell’ and brief views of the windy, rocky coastline and dramatic waves.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 25]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film is a series of scenarios based on a question which is also the title of the reel: ‘Where is it?’ and features Kenneth’s son-in-law Bob Wootton as the person looking for the answer and responding to each segment. Kenneth has Bob look in a book from a bookshelf which contains the hand written sequence titles. Kenneth also uses both black and white and colour sequences to add to the more dramatic feel of the reel. Kenneth has Bob pondering the title questions through the sequences as well as laughing at the end of some. the reel ends with Bob laughing uproariously.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:57:00 first colour scenario begins with title ‘Mr McCraw’s Orchids’ showing us Mr McCraw among his orchid plants in a hothouse as well as Kenneth’s favoured individual shots of individual blooms.

00:02:29:00 we see the next sub title, ‘Eastern Beach Geelong’ followed by colour footage of children playing in the water, foreshore recreational equipment such as diving boards and waterwheels, piers and crowds on the boardwalks and swimmers in and out of the water.

00:05:18:00 several yachts appear in the sea in what could be a race.

00:05:44:00 Bob opens the book again to the sub title ‘Skating at St Moritz’ followed by a colour sequence of a large scale ice skating show involving multiple performers and skotches at St Moritz, (presumably) in Melbourne’s St Kilda.

00:07:45:00 starts with the sub titles, ‘Hobbies - What is yours? Is it Model Boats?’ with Bob gazing toward footage of some intricate model boats and ships sailing and steaming around a shallow (and what appears to be purpose built) pool. The pool is surrounded by older children who appear to be operating the models.

00:14:52:00 Bob reveals the next question ‘or is it Model Trains?’. Here Kenneth shows us a group of men who operate model trains on a track raised high enough from the ground that they are able to ride the trains which seem to operate by steam.

00:18:21:00 ‘Or is it like mine - The Camera?’. Here we see a man in a park with what looks like a ‘box brownie’ camera taking pictures of seemingly random women (though we have seen one of them in other reels).
